bibl.title: Despatch from L de R du Verge
Despatches from United States Consuls in St Paul Loanda

div1.p:
United States Consulate
St Paul de Loanda
July 9th 1883.

To
Hon John Davis
Asst. Secty. of State
Washington D.C.

I have the honor to state that upon the receipt of Dispatch No. 12 from the State Dept, I went South by order of my medical advisor, and visited Benguella, Catumbella & Equimina Bay. "Catemebella is the center of commerce of the interior of Benguella, and the great rendezvous of all the caravans from Balindu and Bihe, I appointed Mr Passens the chief agent of the Dutch African Trading Co. there, to be the agent for the Am: Mission of Balindu & Bihe Equimina Bay is the great rendezvous of Am: Whalers and Mr Bastas Pina a Brazilian gentleman is the owner of the whole bay and has very fine plantations of coffee, cotton, sugar &a he furnishes also vegetables meat water wood &a to the whalers having no customs duties established there, the whalers
